hooks.command: echo [CCO-CONTEXT-CHECK] Check if auto-context contains cco: true marker. If NOT present: Call Task(cco-agent-analyze, scope=config, model=haiku) with prompt: CCO is not configured for this project. Offer setup options first via AskUserQuestion: [Auto-setup] Detect stack and create rules automatically, [Interactive] Ask questions to customize setup, [Skip] Dont configure CCO for this project. If Skip return {skip:true}. If Auto-setup detect without questions return {detected,answers:defaults}. If Interactive ask questions while detecting return {detected,answers}. Then if not skipped: Call Task(cco-agent-apply, scope=config, model=opus) with the configData to write files and output context for immediate use.
